Text saved: Asteroids are rocks that fly through space. Some of them are called 'Potentially Hazardous Asteroids'. These are rocks that can pass close to Earth's path around the sun, within 7.5 million kilometres. NASA has made a map of 1,400 of these asteroids. They do not expect any of them to be a danger in the next one hundred years. With the technology we have now, NASA can follow these objects. They can also predict a possible hit. If this happens, we could use two different solutions to protect Earth.
